sources.title: Brigitte Bardot - The Icon Who Walked Off Set Into the Wild - A rebel with a cause
sources.description:
Cinema's most iconic symbol who traded stardom for animal activism; Brigitte Bardot. This documentary reveals Bardot's radical transformation at age 38, when she abandoned Hollywood glamour to become "Mother of Animals" and launch a global crusade against cruelty.

Directed by Rachel Kahn & Fran√ßois Chaumont
Cast: Ghyslaine Calmels Bock, Boris Cyrulnik, Fabrice d'Almeida, Philippe Grimbert, Christophe Marie, Younous Omarjee


00:00 Full Documentary - Introduction: The Icon's Transformation
0:05:18 - Breaking Point: The Goat Incident Breakthrough
0:10:24 - Early Activism and Public Skepticism & Her controversial 1962 TV appearance 
0:15:36 - Initial struggles to establish the Brigitte Bardot Foundation (1976)
0:20:49 - Seal Rescue Expedition with Franz Weber
0:26:26 - Auctioning Fame for Animal Cause
0:31:12 - Global Rescue Operations: Hippos & Bears
0:36:24 - Ethical Farming Revolution
0:41:36 - Sanctuary Life: Interspecies Bonds
0:50:00 - "My Life Belongs to Animals" Legacy

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics
